alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 9:23PM PST until December 22 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...MORE SNOW ON THE WAY FOR THE CASCADES TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY... .Lingering snow showers in the Cascades will continue to diminish the remainder of tonight, with little or no additional accumulations. However, another storm system will take aim at the Cascades of southwest Washington and central and northern Oregon beginning Tuesday evening and persist through much of Wednesday, bringing the potential for more heavy snow above roughly 3,500 feet. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THIS EVENING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow above roughly 3,500 feet elevation with total snow accumulations from 8 to 12 inches possible. * WHERE...The Cascade Mountains of southern Washington and northern Oregon. * WHEN...Tuesday evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be hazardous due to snow and ice covered roads, and low visibility. Some power outages and tree damage are also possible with the weight of heavy wet snow.
info.instruction: Please monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this developing weather situation. If you have travel plans, be prepared to have an alternative plan our route, and keep snow chains and a winter survival kit in your vehicle.
